definition: in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit

sentences.english: Reports of deaths across the country trickle in almost every day.
sentences.chinese: 全國各地的死亡報告幾乎每天都陸陸續續傳來。

sentences.english: At about that time the debris began to hit the ground.
sentences.chinese: 差不多在那時，航天飛機殘骸開始陸續撞到地面。

sentences.english: After the bell rang, a succession of little visitors came to our door, vying to see Holly.
sentences.chinese: 鈴響後，一夥小參觀者陸續來到門前，爭着要看霍莉。

sentences.english: Please be informed that Property Management Company is conducting continuously HVAC conversion works to CCP.
sentences.chinese: 物業公司正在陸續對園區各樓進行空調轉換工作。

sentences.english: There might be more after that, including an immense bundle of confidential diplomatic cables.
sentences.chinese: 陸續可能還有大量貨色，包括成堆的機密外交電報。

sentences.english: Our publication house plans to publish a series of modern versions of the classics.
sentences.chinese: 出版社計劃陸續出版一些古代經籍的白話譯文。

sentences.english: Recently I put my photos in order and will post them here one by one.
sentences.chinese: 最近抽空整理了一些相片，會將它們陸續傳上來。

sentences.english: The next morning, the courtroom began filling up at eight-thirty.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，八點半的時候人們開始陸續進入法庭。

sentences.english: Every October, white storks fly to the South to spend the winter.
sentences.chinese: 十月的時候，白鸛會陸續飛往南方過冬。

sentences.english: Helicopters delivered materials for the operation Monday morning at the top of the dam.
sentences.chinese: 26日上午，多架直升機已陸續將物資運抵壩頂。

sentences.english: Non- motorized access will be in the "three vertical and three horizontal" peripheral gradually open up.
sentences.chinese: 非機動車通道將在“三橫三縱”的周邊陸續開闢。

sentences.english: At present, some of these people have returned home.
sentences.chinese: 目前一些邊民已經陸續返回。

sentences.english: However afterwards one after another attended each competition and wins an award.
sentences.chinese: 然而後來就陸陸續續地參加各項的比賽並獲獎。

sentences.english: Ocular infections with helminthic parasites are uncommon and have been well described previously.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛的寄生蟲感染相當少見，但陸續都有病例被報告。

sentences.english: Scores of books have followed, selling millions of copies.
sentences.chinese: 海量的讀物陸續出版，熱賣多達上百萬冊。

sentences.english: They were decommissioned from combat successively from the beginning of this century.
sentences.chinese: 這些戰略導彈從本世紀初開始陸續退出戰鬥序列。

definition: auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
